channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Widespread outages follow weekend freezing rain, with more ice ahead
item.description: A massive winter storm brought freezing rain and widespread outages in the South, with icy conditions lingering in the North through Monday.
item.content:encoded: A massive winter storm brought freezing rain and widespread outages in the South, with icy conditions lingering in the North through Monday.
item.dc:creator: Stan Ingold

item.title: In 'The Starseekers', magic, mystery and romance collide with timelines
item.description: Author Nicole Glover's new book 'The Starseekers' focuses on a space-race themed magical murder mystery, with a Black woman at the center.
item.content:encoded: Author Nicole Glover's new book 'The Starseekers' focuses on a space-race themed magical murder mystery, with a Black woman at the center.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: A CrossFit-like race is booming in Asia, and young people are driving the surge
item.description: Hyrox, a timed fitness race that mixes running with workout stations, is selling out across Asia as young people fuel a booming wellness economy.
item.content:encoded: Hyrox, a timed fitness race that mixes running with workout stations, is selling out across Asia as young people fuel a booming wellness economy.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Yang

item.title: Where is the threat from Russia and China in the Arctic?
item.description: As Trump points to Russia and China near Greenland, experts say the biggest Russian and Chinese activity is elsewhere in the Arctic.
item.content:encoded: As Trump points to Russia and China near Greenland, experts say the biggest Russian and Chinese activity is elsewhere in the Arctic.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: The border flow slows to a trickle as asylum cases in Mexico drag on for months
item.description: Barred from the US, stranded in Mexico: migrants at the border have faced uncertainty and stalled asylum claims.
item.content:encoded: Barred from the US, stranded in Mexico: migrants at the border have faced uncertainty and stalled asylum claims.
item.dc:creator: Nina Kravinsky

item.title: We finally watched the movies we were not allowed to see as kids
item.description: Many of our childhood movie choices are defined by the films our parents wouldn't let us see. An NPR panel of movie lovers discusses the films they were forbidden to watch and what it was like to finally see them.
item.content:encoded: Many of our childhood movie choices are defined by the films our parents wouldn't let us see. An NPR panel of movie lovers discusses the films they were forbidden to watch and what it was like to finally see them.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Why de-escalation training and communication matters when federal agents police city streets
item.description: The third Minneapolis shooting in three weeks has renewed questions about immigration agents' role, training, and use of force. We put these questions to Chuck Wexler, executive director of the Police Executive Research Forum.
item.content:encoded: The third Minneapolis shooting in three weeks has renewed questions about immigration agents' role, training, and use of force. We put these questions to Chuck Wexler, executive director of the Police Executive Research Forum.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: A rare snowfall sends Tulsa sledders to the hills
item.description: In Tulsa, Oklahoma, the snow brought out sledders and creative rides, even in extreme cold.
item.content:encoded: In Tulsa, Oklahoma, the snow brought out sledders and creative rides, even in extreme cold.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Videos challenge the Trump administration's account of the Minneapolis killing
item.description: Videos and eyewitnesses appear to contradict the Trump administration's account of the Minneapolis killing, prompting accusations of excessive force and state concerns about a federal investigation they say is excluding them.
item.content:encoded: Videos and eyewitnesses appear to contradict the Trump administration's account of the Minneapolis killing, prompting accusations of excessive force and state concerns about a federal investigation they say is excluding them.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Democrats say they cannot back DHS funding after the Minneapolis killing
item.description: A fatal shooting by a Border Patrol agent in Minneapolis is threatening to derail a DHS funding package and push Congress closer to a partial government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: A fatal shooting by a Border Patrol agent in Minneapolis is threatening to derail a DHS funding package and push Congress closer to a partial government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon
